Words to Kick Your Teeth Out

Mammon

    1. Two found the castle - and petitioned the dragon at
    2. his court - where the beast crouched atop his horde of gold
    1. Lord Mammon - by right of property and on appeal to your convictions?
    2. Might you gift the ring I should inherit?
    1. I know justice. I know mercy
    2. These are the gods that men pray to in my presence!
    1. And there is none, none that not fade away - Yes!
    2. All men all - decay and die, the dragon's horde
    1. Being just - This earthly dust, the dross of man
    2. This golden horde, the skulls of dead _
    1. What's earthly wealth in Hell - is your head!
    2. What should I care for mortal men and mercy?
    1. But I always hunger more... A trade is due.
    1. You ought to lose a heart to make a body whole
    2. Take the ring and lose your heart
    3. Keep your heart and lose your soul
    1. So take this ring then - this too shall pass
    2. Always will mortal's ring - slip away to me
    1. By my father time, a weapon to surpass
    2. All tanks and bombs and fears - all these years
    1. My horde is greater still than any mortal kings
    2. For time makes all men afraid of golden rings!
    1. And with a loud roaring of wind, our hero twisted
    2. And tumbled across the harsh desert sands
    1. Blown about and about and about and about
    2. Singing and sighing and laughing and crying

– Molossus Spondee
